title: 103_hr2662
content: The "Business Improvement Act of 1993" allows contracts awarded to program participants before the enactment of the Act to be considered for business activity targets under the Small Business Act. SEC. 3. PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES. Section 8 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow participating agencies to enter into contracts with small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals through restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10 percent. Section 8 of the Small Business Act allows participating agencies to award contracts to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals through restricted competition or a price preference of up to 10 percent. The authority provided in this section is effective until September 30, 2000. SEC. 4. ELIGIBILITY OF PAST DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS FOR SECTION 8(a) CONTRACT AWARDS. Section (8)(a)(1)(C) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow awards to small businesses owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period as prescribed by section 7(j)(15). This applies to both competitive and sole source awards. The Small Business Act allows awards to small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals who have completed their Program Participation period. Eligibility for contract award is based on the date specified in the solicitation, including for sole source awards. SEC. 5 amends Section 8(a)(1) of the Small Business Act by eliminating competitive contracts under subparagraph (D). SEC. 6 ensures continued access to business opportunities. Section 8(a)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to require competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if there is a reasonable expectation of offers from 2 or more eligible small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals capable of performing the contract. The Small Business Act requires competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if there are offers from 2 or more eligible small businesses owned by economically disadvantaged individuals capable of performing the contract. The contractor currently performing a similar contract must have graduated from the small business development program before the solicitation for the contract is issued. The Small Business Act mandates competition for contracts to furnish products or services to a participating agency if there are offers from 2 or more eligible small businesses owned by economically disadvantaged individuals capable of performing the contract. The head of the agency can restrict competition to small businesses owned by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals upon request. Eligibility for contract award is granted to small businesses that have graduated from the small business development program before the solicitation is issued. A small business concern described in clause (i)(III) may be eligible for a contract award through restricted competition if they agree to subcontract 20-50% of the contract value to small businesses in the developmental stage of minority small business and capital. The head of a participating agency must ensure that after completing a contract awarded through restricted competition, any follow-on contract for similar products or services will also involve subcontracting to small businesses in the developmental stage of minority small business and capital. The head of a participating agency must ensure that any follow-on contract for similar products or services will involve subcontracting to small businesses. SEC. 7. STUDY OF DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM PARTICIPATION TERMS BY INDUSTRY SECTOR; SUSPENSION OF DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM GRADUATIONS. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a short-term study to determine program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Results of the study must be transmitted to specific government bodies within 1 year. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize a short-term study on program participation terms by industry sector for small businesses. Results must be transmitted to specific government bodies within 1 year. Amendments include the suspension of Development Program Graduations. The Small Business Act is amended to allow small businesses in certain programs to continue participation until final regulations are issued based on a study on industry sector terms. Small businesses in certain programs can continue participation until final regulations are issued based on a study on industry sector terms. SEC. 8. COMPLIANCE WITH BUY INDIAN ACT. Federal agencies contracting with the Small Business Administration under section 8(a) for goods or services from economically disadvantaged Indian tribes are considered compliant with the Buy Indian Act. SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS. SEC. 9. UNIFORM PROCEDURES FOR CONTESTING STATUS OF CONCERNS. The Small Business Act is amended to establish uniform procedures for contesting the status of a concern as a 'small business concern owned and controlled by socially and economically disadvantaged individuals'.
